snippet: A marketing agency caused a stir when it hired homeless people to walk around carrying Wi-Fi devices, offering Internet access in exchange for donations.
abstract: Marketing agency BBH Labs touches off a wave of criticism and debate when it hires homeless people to walk around the South by Southwest technology conference in Austin, Tex, carrying Wi-Fi devices; homeless offer conferencegoers Internet access in exchange for donations; many say turning down-and-out people into wireless towers is exploitative and discomfiting.
lead_paragraph: A marketing agency caused a stir when it hired homeless people to walk around carrying Wi-Fi devices, offering Internet access in exchange for donations.

headline.seo: Homeless as Wi-Fi Transmitters Creates a Stir in Austin
headline.main: Use of Homeless as Internet Hot Spots Backfires on Marketer
headline.print_headline: Using the Homeless as Internet Hot Spots Backfires on a Marketer

keywords.value: South by Southwest Music and Media Conference
keywords.name: subject
